column22:
overflow:hidden">
Gun-related suicides and homicides in the United States[
column26:
overflow:hidden">
Handguns are involved in most U.S. gun homicides.[
column30:
overflow:hidden">
Gun-related death rates are positively correlated with household gun ownership rates.[
column34:
overflow:hidden">
A 2023 study concluded that more restrictive state gun policies reduced homicide and suicide gun deaths.[

column1: This is a list of US states by gun deaths and rates of violence. In 2021, there were 26,000 gun suicides and 21,000 gun homicides, together making up a sixth of deaths from external causes. Gun deaths make up about half of all suicides, but over 80% of homicides.[
Gun deaths in 2021 rose to levels not seen since the 1990s, but remained below rates of the 1970s.[
A 2022 study found that guns were the cause of more years lost than any other source of traumatic injury, including motor vehicles.[

Gun death rates

[
column3: section=1" title="Edit section: Gun death rates">edit]

column1: Data are from the CDC and are for the year 2021.[
column3: Rates are per 100,000 inhabitants. Gun ownership estimates are from the RAND Corporation.[
